summary: The "Secretary General of an Institution" serves a pivotal role within EU frameworks, acting as a key figure in integrating various councils and overseeing the operational aspects of institutions. This position entails responsibilities such as managing budgets, recruitment, and the remuneration of civil servants. The Secretary General ensures transparency and openness in institutional processes, often involving secondments and the migration of personnel. Notably, figures like Javier Solana and Pierre Madariaga have exemplified this role, contributing to the vision of a cohesive EU. Their leadership impacts salaries, pensions, and the discharge of duties, while adapting to digital transformations and maintaining effective communication through platforms like SISNET and SIRENE.
